TITLE: Initializing a Basic Crawler with Colly in Go
DESCRIPTION: This Go code snippet demonstrates how to set up a simple web crawler using the Colly framework. It initializes a new collector, attaches event handlers for processing HTML anchor tags and for logging requests, and starts crawling from a specified URL. To run this example, the 'github.com/gocolly/colly/v2' package must be imported and installed. The snippet expects a starting URL and uses OnHTML callbacks to find and visit all hyperlinks on the target page, printing out each visited URL to the standard output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocolly/colly/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
func main() {
	c := colly.NewCollector()

	// Find and visit all links
	c.OnHTML("a[href]", func(e *colly.HTMLElement) {
		e.Request.Visit(e.Attr("href"))
	})

	c.OnRequest(func(r *colly.Request) {
		fmt.Println("Visiting", r.URL)
	})

	c.Visit("http://go-colly.org/")
}
```

TITLE: Installing Colly Dependency via go.mod in Go
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the minimal addition to a Go project's go.mod file to declare a dependency on the Colly framework at the latest version. It specifies the module path for your project, the Go version, and adds 'github.com/gocolly/colly/v2' as a required dependency. This is necessary to ensure the Colly package is properly tracked and available for import in your Go project. Replace 'github.com/x/y' with your actual module path as appropriate.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocolly/colly/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
module github.com/x/y

go 1.14

require (
        github.com/gocolly/colly/v2 latest
)
```

TITLE: Documenting Colly Version 2.0.0 Release Notes
DESCRIPTION: Details the changes in Colly version 2.0.0, including breaking changes, new features like Go module support and HasVisited method, and multiple bugfixes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocolly/colly/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
# 2.0.0 - 2019.11.28

 - Breaking change: Change Collector.RedirectHandler member to Collector.SetRedirectHandler function
 - Go module support
 - Collector.HasVisited method added to be able to check if an url has been visited
 - Collector.SetClient method introduced
 - HTMLElement.ChildTexts method added
 - New user agents
 - Multiple bugfixes
```

TITLE: Documenting Colly Version 2.1.0 Release Notes
DESCRIPTION: Lists the changes and improvements in Colly version 2.1.0, including new features like HTTP tracing support and OnResponseHeader callback, as well as various fixes and dependency updates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocolly/colly/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:

```
# 2.1.0 - 2020.06.09

 - HTTP tracing support
 - New callback: OnResponseHeader
 - Queue fixes
 - New collector option: Collector.CheckHead
 - Proxy fixes
 - Fixed POST revisit checking
 - Updated dependencies
```

TITLE: Documenting Colly Version 1.2.0 Release Notes
DESCRIPTION: Outlines the updates in Colly version 1.2.0, including compatibility improvements, new request shortcuts, and various bug fixes and enhancements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocolly/colly/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
# 1.2.0 - 2019.02.13

 - Compatibility with the latest htmlquery package
 - New request shortcut for HEAD requests
 - Check URL availibility before visiting
 - Fix proxy URL value
 - Request counter fix
 - Minor fixes in examples
```

TITLE: Documenting Colly Version 1.1.0 Release Notes
DESCRIPTION: Lists the changes in Colly version 1.1.0, including API changes for Appengine integration, new features like gzip decompression support, and various bug fixes and improvements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/gocolly/colly/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
# 1.1.0 - 2018.08.13

 - Appengine integration takes context.Context instead of http.Request (API change)
 - Added "Accept" http header by default to every request
 - Support slices of pointers in unmarshal
 - Fixed a race condition in queues
 - ForEachWithBreak method added to HTMLElement
 - Added a local file example
 - Support gzip decompression of response bodies
 - Don't share waitgroup when cloning a collector
 - Fixed instagram example
```
